Ragging of any nature is strictly prohibited. Ragging is a punishable offence under Central Government Act. Violation of this rule will attract any one or more of following possible punishments depending upon the seriousness of the issue: 
 i. One year suspension from the institute 
 ii. A fine up to Rs. 2500/- 
 iii. Expulsion from the institute. 
 iv. Suspension from the institute or classes for a limited period 
 v. Fine with a public apology. 
 vi. Withholding scholarships or other benefits. 
 vii. Debarring from representation in events. 
 viii. Withholding results. 
 ix. Suspension or expulsion from the Halls of Residence.
